text:
- We build autonomous gen
AI platforms for enterprises
to solve the core of their problems.
So, think of, say an aerospace company,

or an oil and gas company
or a manufacturing company.
Each of those domains have their own
massive amounts of datasets
that are specific to that domain.
We're using those datasets to build models
that can actually understand the domain
to a high degree of accuracy,
and the first thing we need to do
is build those large models.

For that, we really need
large-scale, high-performance,
highly-available infrastructure

that can be used for
training these models.

That's one of the major challenges
we are solving with AWS,
thanks to their scale
and also services like say HyperPort,

which are enabling us to
get our training pipelines
up and running very quickly.

With Managed Services, the
promise has always been
that it will improve your productivity,
it'll increase your time to value.
This is a case

where we actually saw
that happen in real time.

So, from the time we
started using HyperPort

to us actually starting
to get productivity gains
was a matter of days.
And in terms of productivity gains,
onboarding new researchers

improved by a factor of at
least three to five times.
Our productivity gains

in terms of getting models up
and running and having that
went up by three times,

so our failure rates went
from 10 to 15% to under 5%.

Customer onboarding time
improved by at least 2x,
and those three things, I would say,

in a matter of just a few
months of us using HyperPort,
have been phenomenal.
(bright subtle music)
